org.kiji.schema.impl.hbase
Class HBaseAtomicKijiPutter

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.impl.hbase.HBaseAtomicKijiPutter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AtomicKijiPutter
@ApiAudience.Private
public final class HBaseAtomicKijiPutter
extends Object
implements AtomicKijiPutter

HBase implementation of AtomicKijiPutter. Access via HBaseKijiWriterFactory.openAtomicKijiPutter(), facilitates guaranteed atomic puts in batch on a single row. Use begin(EntityId) to open a new transaction, put(family, qualifier, value) to stage a put in the transaction, and commit() or checkAndCommit(family, qualifier, value) to write all staged puts atomically. This class is not thread-safe. It is the user's responsibility to protect against concurrent access to a writer while a transaction is being constructed.

checkAndCommit

public <T> boolean checkAndCommit(String family,
                                  String qualifier,
                                  T value)
                       throws IOException
Atomically tests the content of a cell for a specific value, and performs the accumulated puts if the test succeeds.

  • If the passed value is null, the check is for the lack of a cell (i.e. non-existance).
  • If the check fails, the current transaction remains open and unmodified. It is up to the caller to retry or rollback.
  • If the commit succeeds, the current transaction is completed and a new transaction may start with begin().

    Specified by:
    checkAndCommit in interface AtomicKijiPutter
    Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the data to be checked.
    Parameters:
    family - Column Family of the cell to check.
    qualifier - Column Qualifier of the cell to check.
    value - Data in the cell to check.
    Returns:
    Whether the check passed and Put executed.
    Throws:
    IOException - in case of an error.

    • rollback

    public void rollback()
    Discards the current transaction.

    The current transaction is aborted, the accumulated puts are lost. No calls to put(), commit() or checkAndCommit() are allowed until a new transaction may start with begin().

    Specified by:
    rollback in interface AtomicKijiPutter
